result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher T Eck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not have any contact with Country Inn & Suites in West Bend unless the defendant's probation agent authorizes contact (applies to both counts)
Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent. Defendant shall take medications as prescribed. (Conditions apply to both counts)

Court proceeds to sentencing. Atty. Weil will submit a letter concerning sentence credit.

Hearing on competency scheduled. State to arrange Dr. Rawski to testify; phone testimony permitted. Hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 11:00 am.
